description._content: Bain News Service,, publisher. N.Y. City lodging house [between ca. 1909 and ca. 1915] 1 negative : glass ; 5 x 7 in. or smaller. Notes: Title from data provided by the Bain News Service on the negative. Photograph shows a police officer and staff? at the Municipal Lodging House of New York City, which opened in February 1909 at 432-438 East 25th Street. (Source: American Labor Legislation Review, vol. 5 (1915), p. 616) Forms part of: George Grantham Bain Collection (Library of Congress). Format: Glass negatives. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print General information about the Bain Collection is available at hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.ggbain Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ggbain.15134 Call Number: LC-B2- 2950-12

note._content: thumb screw for interrogating uncooperative suspects
note.author: 29079609@N02

note._content: Thumbscrew? An amusing notion, but more likely it is part of the letterpress system for preserving copies of typed (or handwritten) documents. The four ledgers beside the apparatus appear to be letterpress books.
note.author: 70251312@N00

note._content: yes of course, I was just attempting to add some fun, even the LOC has a sense of humor.  Some of this stuff will always remain a mystery so we make up our own stories
note.author: 29079609@N02
